content: Many animal rights activists, who believe non-domesticated species belong in the wild, have condemned so-called "exotic" pet ownership. An increasing number of U.S. cities and counties have banned the ownership of certain wild animals, like mountain lions and wolves, for public safety reasons. And the connection between monkeypox and prairie dogs is causing some people to question whether any wild animals should be kept as pets.
translations: ita:Molti attivisti per i diritti degli animali, che credono che le specie non domestiche appartengano alla natura selvaggia
